byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michael R. Gordon and Alan Rappeport from Washington, Michael Barbaro and Amy Chozick from New York, David E. Sanger from Basalt, Colo., and Nick Corasaniti from Memphis.

abstract: Jeb Bush attacks Pres Obama and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton over their handling of withdrawal of American troops from Iraq, arguing too hasty exit set stage for rise of Islamic State; statement puts Clinton, who lost presidential nomination to Obama in 2008 in part due to her support of Iraq War, in awkward position of defending Obama's orchestration of American exodus as she seeks to capture 2016 Democratic nomination.
lead_paragraph: In a blistering attack, Mr. Bush said the early withdrawal of American troops set the stage for the chaos now sweeping the region.

headline.main: Jeb Bush Blames Hillary Clinton and Obama for Iraq’s Decline
headline.print_headline: Bush Asserts a Clinton Role in Iraq Decline

snippet: In a blistering attack, Mr. Bush said the early withdrawal of American troops set the stage for the chaos now sweeping the region.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
